This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. params.account: The address of the account to evaluate.
params.assetId: The identifier of the asset to validate the policy status.

params.account: The address of the account for which policies are being retrieved.

returns._0: The address of the contract responsible for authorizing rights policies.

params.account: The address of the user whose compliance is being evaluated.
params.assetId: The identifier of the asset to validate the policy status.
params.policyAddress: The address of the policy contract to check compliance against.

isConsumingScheduledOp().details: Returns true only in the context of a delayed restricted call, at the moment that the scheduled operation is being consumed. Prevents denial of service for delayed restricted calls in the case that the contract performs attacker controlled calls.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

registerPolicy(uint256,address,address).details: This function verifies the policy's authorization, executes the agreement and registers the policy.

params.holder: The rights holder whose authorization is required for accessing the asset.
params.policyAddress: The address of the policy contract managing the agreement.
params.proof: The unique identifier of the agreement to be enforced.

setAuthority(address).details: Transfers control to a new authority. The caller must be the current authority.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

getActivePolicy(address,uint256).notice: Retrieves the first active policy for a specific account in LIFO order.

getPolicies(address).notice: Retrieves the list of policys associated with a specific account and content ID.

getPolicyAuthorizer().notice: Retrieves the address of the Rights Policies Authorizer contract.

isActivePolicy(address,uint256,address).notice: Verifies if a specific policy is active for the provided account and criteria.

registerPolicy(uint256,address,address).notice: Finalizes the agreement by registering the agreed-upon policy, effectively closing the agreement.
